item.title: Prisoner dies at DMCH
item.description: An inmate of Dhaka Central Jail died at Dhaka Medical College Hospital (DMCH) on Saturday. The deceased was identified as Miaz Uddin, 60, son of Binod Ali, reports UNB. Inspector Md Faruk, in charge of DMCH police camp, said Miaz Uddin fell sick at the jail on Friday night and he was taken to the

item.title: Nobel Prize in Physics marks 100 years of Quantum wonders
item.description: It's been a hundred years since scientists opened the mysterious box of quantum theory. The questions have only grown stranger. This year, the Nobel Prize in Physics goes to three researchers—John Clark, Michelle Deere, and John Martinez—for their groundbreaking work on quantum tunnelli

item.title: Security beefed up at Ctg airport, port amid fears of cyber attack
item.description: Authorities have strengthened security in and around Shah Amanat International Airport and the seaport amid fears of possible cyberattacks. To prevent any untoward incidents, the airport and police authorities have taken joint precautionary measures including setting up a four-tier security cordon

item.title: Duelling protests sparked by July fighter's 'harassment' paralyses Dhaka-Mymensingh traffic
item.description: Road communication between Dhaka and Mymensingh has been disrupted following duelling protests by students and transport workers after a gazetted July fighter was allegedly harassed on a United Service bus. Members of the Students Against Discrimination and transport workers staged counter demonst

item.title: Battle lines drawn over Confederate tribute at Georgia's Stone Mountain
item.description: The heroic images of three Confederate leaders carved into the granite face of Georgia's Stone Mountain have towered over the countryside outside Atlanta since the 1970s, paying silent homage to the Southern cause in the US Civil War. Its supporters say the monument - often compared with Mou

item.title: BNP's Moyeen Khan rejects proportional representation system
item.description: Strongly opposing the introduction of a proportional representation (PR) system, BNP senior leader Dr Abdul Moyeen Khan on Saturday said it would only strengthen political parties while weakening the link between people and their elected representatives, ultimately causing suffering for the public.

item.title: Elections and referendum on same day? Consensus panel to ask government to decide
item.description: The National Consensus Commission will propose that the government decide whether to hold the national election and the referendum at the same time, panel member Badiul Alam Majumdar has said.
